revised_title: Periodic Colors Produced by Grooved Metallic and Transparent Surfaces
tldr: The author, David Brewster, discovered a new series of periodic colors produced by grooved surfaces of metallic and transparent bodies. These colors are formed by the interaction of light with the grooves and can be observed in the prismatic images. The author also found that certain colors are defalcated or obliterated at specific angles of incidence, leading to the development of different orders of colors in the images.
